definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
ancient cooking cauldron with two looped handles and three or four legs/pot (dialect)/to enter upon a period of (classical)/Kangxi radical 206/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes
ancient cooking cauldron with two looped handles and three or four legs/pot (dialect)/to enter upon a period of (classical)/Kangxi radical 206/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes

sentences.english: The Marquis de Montcalm was at that time a celebrated royalist .
sentences.chinese: 安静山侯爵是当时一个大名鼎鼎的保王党。

sentences.english: The famous actor now lives in seclusion.
sentences.chinese: 这位大名鼎鼎的演员现在深居简出了。

sentences.english: The child would grow up to be Bacchus, the great god of wine.
sentences.chinese: 这个婴儿就是大名鼎鼎的酒神巴克斯。

sentences.english: The marquis de montcalm was at that time a celebrated royalist.
sentences.chinese: 安静山侯爵是当时一个大名鼎鼎的保王党。

sentences.english: This is Mr. Fan, the historian.
sentences.chinese: 这个就是大名鼎鼎的历史学家范先生。

sentences.english: The first to talk about the famous " Xi State Golden pear".
sentences.chinese: 先来说说大名鼎鼎的“隰州金梨”。

sentences.english: In Hollywood, he is renowned for his ability to solicit money.
sentences.chinese: 在好莱坞，他募集资金的能力大名鼎鼎。

sentences.english: Be in Nanjing, have the Nanjing master shrine of a famous.
sentences.chinese: 在南京，有一个大名鼎鼎的南京夫子庙。

sentences.english: This is the famous tri-color glazed camel carrying musicians.
sentences.chinese: 这就是大名鼎鼎的三彩骆驼载乐俑。

sentences.english: And then went to the famous Temple.
sentences.chinese: 然后就去了大名鼎鼎的武侯祠。

sentences.english: I made the acquaintance of the well-known adventuress.
sentences.chinese: 我认识了大名鼎鼎的女冒险家。

sentences.english: A few big name outfitters line the street as well as a number of specialty shops.
sentences.chinese: 一些大名鼎鼎的套装店在这里沿街排开。

sentences.english: There isn’t anyone who doesn’t known he is a famous writer.
sentences.chinese: 谁都知道他是大名鼎鼎的作家。

sentences.english: In Nanjing, has a famous Nanjing Confucian temple.
sentences.chinese: 在南京，有一个大名鼎鼎的南京夫子庙。

sentences.english: Who doesn’t know the well-known Master Jim?
sentences.chinese: 谁不知道大名鼎鼎的吉姆老爷？

definition: lit. like thunder piercing the ear/a well-known reputation (idiom)
to be known as/to be nicknamed/to be purportedly/to claim (often exaggeratedly or falsely)
well-known for sth/to become well known/to make one's mark
to achieve fame among one's contemporaries (idiom); temporary or local celebrity
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
the earliest ancestor/originator (of a tradition, school of thought etc)
